result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:49 PM Defendant Mark A Zakula appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert F Nagel appeared by video for Mark A Zakula.  Attorney Matt Lantta not in court. In patient evaluation has not been completed. The Court requests matter be set out. Matter set over.

Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:58 PM Defendant Mark A Zakula appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert F Nagel appeared by video for Mark A Zakula. Parties request inpatient competency exam to be completed. The Court orders the clerk to prepare order. Matter set over.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on October 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Clerk emailed Competency Order and Criminal Complaint to DHS and WFU

10:58 AM Defendant Mark A Zakula appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert F Nagel appeared by video for Mark A Zakula.  Attorney Matt Lantta appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The Court requests Attorney Nagel to explain his place on why he requests Dr. Lytton to do the evaluation. Attorney Nagel explains. The State is not requesting Dr. Lytton and is not objecting to having Dr. Lytton preform the evaluation. The Court will appoint the State to complete the evaluation unless the defendant chooses to pay for it himself. Attorney Nagel requests a breakout session to talk to his client.  Parties return. Defendant wishes for the court to appoint the Wisconsin State Forensic unit to complete the evaluation. Attorney Nagel requests Dr. Schoenecker to complete evaluation. Matter set over to October 3, 2022 at 2:00 PM.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Nagel filed a motion to reschedule plea and sentencing hearing. Bond continues. Matter set over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:33 AM Mark A Zakula, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Robert F Nagel. Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney. Preliminary Hearing Questionaire & Waiver filed with the court.  Attorney Lantta to file Information   Defendant waives reading of information.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Matter set over. Issuing Agency: GCSD
Violations: 1) OWI 4th 2) Operate with PAC 
Conditions: May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores. May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. Defendant is not allowed to drive what so ever.
Defendant waived time limits to schedule preliminary hearing.
